caption: This photograph shows a large river in the background, with a wide expanse of water stretching to a tree-lined far shore under a bright sky. The foreground is dominated by a pile of debris that includes various objects such as a rusty metal barrel, scattered cans, branches, and other miscellaneous waste materials. The debris leads up to the bank of the river, suggesting either a dumping ground or wash-up from the river itself. The overall scene presents a contrast between the natural beauty of the peaceful river and the human-created pollution cluttering its bank, signaling environmental neglect or damage.
title: The south bank of the Kansas River on the east side of Lawrence has become a much used dumping ground.
